intro: Androsace centriberica subsp. assoana, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it tolerates cold and harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
